Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; glaze fired orange-brown; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed below; part of lotus flower in added red and added white; exterior: row of dots at rim; painted decoration consisting of goose (head and part of neck remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, but dated later than those chalices because she considers the style of the drawing to be debased and because of the elementary and isolated interior decoration (Lemos 1991, 72-3). The rim pattern is not typical of the Wild Goat Style, but rather of the later Mature Animal Style. Furthermore, the presence of interior decoration is not consistent with the Wild Goat Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 240, no. 207)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0449) (phase 2)
